intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris convexiuscula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy surface, and its fruit is a short, triangular silique. It is native to Europe but has been introduced to other parts of the world. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
